Description: Rim sherd (mended from three fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; palmette and lotus flower in added white and added red; below, two white lines, then tongue pattern in white outline with alternate red tongues; exterior: zigzag band between lines, all in dilute, at rim; below, painted decoration consisting of dog (head and forelegs lost) to right; below, band of vertical strokes between dilute lines.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the interior and exterior decoration, see Liverpool 56,21,526. The number 780 is written in pencil on the interior, and there is a label with 'A959' on the exterior.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 297, no. 983.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1982) (phase 2)
